The town is located near the end of the M4.
The town is small enough to cover on foot.  A historic Town Trail leaflet guides visitors around the oldest part of town, with display boards.

value: . The park is home to a herd of white cattle and also has a lake and a deer park. Admission for house and park (standard rate): adult £5.45, child £2.72, family £13.63.
. This row of attractive, pastel colored houses is the most famous and recognizable landmark in the town.
directions=via National Trust or walk up from Llandeilo bridge through Castle Woods

content=Beautiful castle on a high crag overlooking the River Towy.  Climb up the round tower, walk the battlements and see the wonderful views.  Free entry to the castle on foot, but car park charges apply in the National Trust car park at Newton House.
directions=Gate near Llandeilo Bridge or access via Dinefwr Park.

content=Beautiful nature reserve of the Wildlife Trust, in a peaceful setting by the River Towy.  Geologically interesting, with birds, badgers, and bluebells among other delights at any time of year.

Llandeilo has a fantastic range of boutique shops located on Rhosmaen Street, King Street and Market Street.

content=There are 2 large antiques venues on Station Road:  The Works and James Ash. Once a month an Antiques Fair is held at the Civic Hall, and also a Car Boot Sale takes place there monthly.
name=The Angel Inn and Capel Bach Bistro

content=The Fig Tree Restaurant and Wine Bar, located 5 miles west of Llandeilo in the Towy Valley.
content=An award winning restaurant in Salem, 3 miles north of Llandeilo.
content=Contemporary cuisine, served in the bar or restaurant. Great views of Llandeilo in the garden.

There are several pubs in the town including the Salutation Inn, The Castle Hotel, The White Horse Inn  and The Angel Inn. The Cawdor hotel also has a bar open to non-residents. There are also a number of pubs a short walk over the bridge in Ffairfach.

Evan Evans Brewery is based in the town, and supplies many local pubs with its speciality ales.

During the day, Barita Delicatessen, Ollies and Gegin Fach y Gwili are also open for drinks and snacks.

value: content=A boutique hotel housed in a Georgian listed building in the heart of Llandeilo.
content=Offering boutique hotel style with the personal service of a luxury Bed and Breakfast.

content=Lisa & James Woodward have converted an old butter house into a five star comfortable Character cottage, self catering suitable for up to 6+cot. Private but on the outskirts of town. Mini Breaks available.
address=Parc y Brenin Cottage, Cwrt Henri, Llandeilio
